data.title: battlesite expeditions and tours
data.text:
94th Infantry Combat Reels in DVD

Jonathan Field Collection - Military Caskets, Urns, etc., http://www.jonathanfieldcollection.com

National Personnel Records Center

Army (or Air Force, Marines, Navy, Coast Guard)

1 Archives Drive

St. Louis, MO 63138

Telephone 314-801-0800

Fax: 314-801-9195

E-mail: MPR.center@nara.gov

Website: http://www.archives.gov/st-louis/#address

Provide them with as much information as you have on your relative, such as name, branch of service, serial number or social security number, and dates of service. Allow about six months for a reply.

U.S. Military History Institute

Attn. Historical Reference Branch

22 Asburn Drive

Carlisle Barracks, PA 17013-5008

Website: carlisle-www.army.mil

Information on Army personnel.

Library of Congress

Website: www.loc.gov/vets

good resource for Veterans/families looking for written and oral information.

Military.com

Website: www.military.com

Website full of information on various units and unit reunions.

National Archives

World War II Honor List of Dead and Missing Army and Army Air Forces Personnel

Website: www.archives.gov/research/arc/ww2/army-casualties

Golden Arrow Military Research

Website: http://www.goldenarrowresearch.com/historical-research.php

Specializes in tracing the steps of individual WWII Veterans through the war to show where they were and what they did during their time in the service. Read comments from clients.

National Cemetery Administration

Website: www.cem.va.gov/nprc.htm

Information and links about veteran's benefits and services.

First Marine Division (Korean War)

Website: www.koreanwar.org/html/units/usmc/1mardivhq.htm

Pacific Wreck Database

Website: www.pacificwrecks.com/

The Pacific Wreck Database (PWD) is a free, non-profit website compiles the work of veterans, authors, travelers & visitors from around the world, as well as and anyone with knowledge to share on this topic.

American Battle Monuments Commission

Website: www.abmc.gov

The ABMC commemorative mission is reflected in 24 overseas military cemeteries that serve as resting places for almost 125,000 American War Dead; on Tablets of the Missing that memorialize more than 94,000 U.S. servicemen and women; and through 25 memorials, monuments and markers.

Remember the Deadeyes.com

Website designed to help everyone remember the Deadeyes of the 96th Division of the U.S. Army who served in WWII, and members of the 96th Readiness Command who are serving around the world.

BizTravelGuide.com

Travel directory. Provides Travel Guide Directory Resource and Information.

www.philippine-scouts.org

Website and message board of the Philippine Scouts Heritage Society.

www.FlightNetwork.com

Made a flight booking here recently, and later found out that they were the best prices available online.

www.guadalcanal.com

Tourism, Travel, & Information Guide to the Province of Guadalcanal in the Solomon Islands.

Kilroy Was Here - Unknown stories and forgotten places. WWII & Korean war Secrets. Unknown stories revealed & places rediscovered Personal stories of combat & home front, legends, Gremlins and foofighters.

http://www.sharkhunters.com

WWII Submarine historical organization
